roombaif

Class RoombaSerialIF

  • java.lang.Object
    • roombaif.RoombaIF
      • roombaif.RoombaSerialIF

  • public class RoombaSerialIF
extends RoombaIF
    An interface to an iRobot Roomba 595 via a serial port. We assume the Roomba is set for 115200 baud, its default rate. Resetting the Roomba (by turning it on and holding down the Spot and Dock buttons) should reset it to 115200 baud. For further information, including the meaning of the sensor data packets, consult the iRobot Roomba 500 Open Interface (OI) Specification.

    • Method Detail

      • openIF

        public void openIF(boolean safeMode)
            throws RoombaIFException
        Open the serial interface to the Roomba. We place the Roomba into Safe or Full control mode and start the sensor data streaming.
        Specified by:
        openIF in class RoombaIF
        Parameters:
        safeMode - true for safe control mode, false for full control mode
        Throws:
        RoombaIFException

      • driveCommand

        public void driveCommand(short velocity,
                short radius)
                  throws RoombaIFException
        Control the Roomba's drive wheels.

        To drive straight use radi serialPort.purgePort(serialPort.PURGE_RXCLEAR | serialPort.PURGE_TXCLEAR); us -32768 or 32767. To turn in place clockwise use radius -1. To turn in place anticlockwise use radius 1.

        Specified by:
        driveCommand in class RoombaIF
        Parameters:
        velocity - in mm/s
        radius - in mm, positive is left, negative is right
        Throws:
        RoombaIFException

      • motorsCommand

        public void motorsCommand(boolean sideBrush,
                 boolean sideBrushClockwise,
                 boolean mainBrush,
                 boolean mainBrushOutward,
                 boolean vacuum)
                   throws RoombaIFException
        Control the forward and backward motion of the main brush, side brush and vacuum. When enabled these motors will run at full speed. (Variable speed is possible with a PWM_MOTORS command, not yet implemented here.)
        Specified by:
        motorsCommand in class RoombaIF
        Parameters:
        sideBrush -
        sideBrushClockwise -
        mainBrush -
        mainBrushOutward -
        vacuum -
        Throws:
        RoombaIFException
